title: Conditionals in Java

explanation.short: Java conditionals use if, else if, else, and switch statements to control program flow.
explanation.detailed: Java supports if-else statements for conditional execution, switch statements for multiple value checks, and ternary operator for simple conditions. Conditions must be boolean expressions. Braces are recommended even for single statements. Java also supports switch expressions (Java 12+).

key_points: Braces recommended even for single statements
best_practices: Always use braces, even for single statements
Use parentheses to clarify complex conditions
Use switch for multiple value checks on same variable
Use equals() for String comparison, not ==
Remember to break in switch statements
Consider switch expressions for cleaner code (Java 12+)

common_mistakes.explanation: Use equals() method for String comparison
Missing break causes fall-through to next case
